revisionDesc.change: Vote - Accept-Straight-to-Finalization - Accept as is. Taken directly from ed pr.
Entered text and translation from my full edition of the descriptum in ZPE 170 (2010) 160-61.

div.p: Plutarchus and A–, the established superintendents and assistants of the katalochismoi registers of the Oxyrhynchite (nome), to the agoranomi, greetings. Tacheos alias Apollonarion, daughter of Teos, son of Teos, with her cousin Harthoonis, son of Pemous, son of Harthoonis, as guardian, having paid the tax on mortgage of the (land) mortgaged to her by Dionysia, officially styled as daughter of mother Diogenis, daughter of Cronius, (situated) around Se– of the Western toparchy ...
